I'll create a Volunteer Opportunities Tracker app with mock data. The app will include features to browse opportunities, filter them, and track applications.



This app includes the following features:

1. Browse volunteer opportunities with details like:
   - Title and organization
   - Location
   - Time commitment (hours per week)
   - Required skills
   - Start date
   - Available spots

2. Search and filter capabilities:
   - Keyword search across title, organization, and skills
   - Location filter
   - Hours per week filter
   - Sort by different criteria
   - Option to show only available positions

3. Application tracking:
   - View opportunities in a data grid
   - Select and apply for positions
   - View all applications in a separate tab
   - Application status tracking

4. User Interface:
   - Clean, responsive layout with sidebar navigation
   - Modal dialogs for application confirmation
   - Notifications for successful actions
   - Data tables with sorting and filtering capabilities

5. Mock Data:
   - Generated realistic sample data for 20 volunteer opportunities
   - Varied locations, time commitments, and skill requirements
   - Random availability of spots

The app uses several Shiny components including:
- Reactive values and calculations
- Data grid outputs
- Modal dialogs
- Notifications
- Tab panels
- Input controls (text, select, slider, switch)
- Layout components (sidebar, fluid page, cards)

Users can easily browse opportunities, filter based on their preferences, and track their applications all in one place.
